guide.introduction:
If you have some papers that need to be held together but don't have a stapler, or don't want to use one, you can make a taple.

You can hold the papers together temporarily, or you can make the me permanent with a bit of tape.
guide.introduction_rendered:
If you have some papers that need to be held together but don't have a stapler, or don't want to use one, you can make a taple.

You can hold the papers together temporarily, or you can make the me permanent with a bit of tape.

lines.text: Gather your papers together in a neat stack.
lines.text_raw: Gather your papers together in a neat stack.

lines.text: Fold the pages at a corner.
lines.text_raw: Fold the pages at a corner.

lines.text: Make two parallel tears perpendicular to the fold about a quarter inch apart.
lines.text_raw: Make two parallel tears perpendicular to the fold about a quarter inch apart.

lines.text: Fold this tab opposite of the triangular corner tab. Your pages are now held together, but not permanent.
lines.text_raw: Fold this tab opposite of the triangular corner tab. Your pages are now held together, but not permanent.

lines.text: Put a small piece of tape over the tab to hold it in place. This should be a permanent way to hold the pages.

guide.summary:
Sometimes you need to attach several pieces of paper together but don't have a stapler. 

Here is a technique that I use that somebody showed me in grade school.
guide.title: Make a Taple
